author: av8r1973
title: Simply great.
review:
My wife picked this up at the Carrefour store in Neihu, Taipei yesterday on sale.  Yes, a new kit on sale.First off, this is one of the best vehicles in my collection.  It certainly has the most playability of any single vehicle.  The trailer opens beautifully into a full-blown command center.  The roof and both doors open smoothly and there is no sagging.The jail cell in back is great.  My 3 and 5yo daughters have learned what a jail is now.  :)The build was fun with some pieces I hadn't seen before, and some others I haven't seen since the late seventies. The motorcycle was just about like the standalone bike, but without the saddlebags.  At least I have one for each girl now.  The "getaway" car was fun and both girls like to chase the bad guy.Overall, great kit and one that will be well-used.

UPDATE 1/3/11: TRU in Taipei has the new police truck (2011 set) and I closely compared the two.  Not sure why LEGO released another mobile police truck since this one was so good.  The new one has a side that flips up, but this one has an opening roof and double-swinging doors.  Very cool.  Get this one instead.

author: coldcomfort
title: 7288 Mobile Police Unit - An impressive addition to the City police arsenal.
review:
This is my second set after reintroducing myself to Lego building. It probably should have been my first. It is solid, large, attractive and the build was very enjoyable. It includes a number of unusual elements and accessories that lend themselves well to other creative building projects. This is my first police item for my city, and short of the police station itself I couldn't have picked better.

Pros

  • At just over 11 cents American per piece, this set represents an impressive value and is priced generously.
  • The design of this set is very imaginative and would lend itself well to play. The fold out walls and tip up roof on the trailer allow total access to the surveillance center and the other doors are placed so that nothing within the trailer is difficult to reach.
  • Some of the details on this set are above and beyond what I expect from Lego. As an ex-trucker I appreciate the details on the rig in particular. The molded airfoil on top of the cab over truck is in keeping with practical design and the smoke stacks behind the sleeper (which only lacks a bed to make the tractor spot on) made me chuckle. I particularly enjoyed building the headlight/grill assembly. The little coffee pot in the trailer is a hoot!

Cons

  • While I appreciate how accessible the surveillance center is by way of the fold out walls and flip up roof, the combination of these elements makes the trailer a bit weak. I imagine that if this vehicle were involved in rigorous play several pieces of it would commonly fall apart.
  • The instructions did not direct where to place three of the decals. You have to figure it out by looking at the box and deciding where you like them best.

Overall, I have to call this set fantastic as it was fun to build, looks great, was an excellent value and implies a story with the included elements and minifigures. If you enjoy the police aspect of the City theme, you will probably love this set.

author: AETerry
title: Mobile Police Unit Review
review:
2011 saw me looking to expand and update my LEGO City Police Collection. It's one of those themes that's a staple for anyone collecting and building a LEGO City. So it's good that every few years, LEGO releases another series of Police sets for any kids and adult collectors looking add to or start a LEGO City.

Box/Instructions

The box isn't too outstanding, cardboard and clear pictures of what theme it's for and what you're getting in this set.

The instruction booklets have clear, illustrated step-by-step pictures for each stage of the build, complete at the end with a list of all the parts in the set for any possible replacements for lost pieces later on.

Parts

In all, there are 408 pieces in the set, which when considering the number of minifigures and some specialty pieces like the motorcycle, it's not a bad deal over all for the price of the set at $45 when it first came out.

Also, love them or hate them, there are stickers in this set, of which a child may need and want an adult to help them place.

Minifigures

In all, there are three minifigures, which isn't bad. I'd rather have a couple of figures and a really good build. With having collected so many police sets over the years and building a few from a LEGO pick-a-brick feature, any extras I want to include in this set for play or display, I can easilly do so.

You've got a Police Motorcycle Officer, a brown haired blue shirt uniformed police minifigure who drives the truck and operates the computers inside the Mobile Unit and then of course, the crook or bad guy that the police chase down to capture or recapture.

The build and completed model

In all, I'm very happy and satisfied with this set. I can see a child being busy for hours with this set given all the features in it. The radar that can be lifted up and rotated around, the jail cell on the back of the Mobile Unit Trailer, the doors and top that can be swung open for easier access inside the Mobile Unit, the storage place up front for all the small builds like cones, handcuffs, fence and even magnifying glass that can be stored there.

The Trailer has a stand that can be put down so the truck can pull away from it. There's my new favorite of the new style police motorcycles and the red car that the thief is driving for playing out any chase scenes.

Summary

Yes this set is similar to an earlier Police Set that came out around 2008-2009 and has a few more features. For me, I don't see that as a problem when considering that the City themes and LEGO in general are geared towards children and every few years, there's bound to be a new group of kids wanting to build their Police Collection and if they missed out in one year, there's a new series coming out. So I don't see the apparent redundancy of the Police theme being that bad.

If you're not collecting City or feel you've got enough Police sets and this one is too similar to an older one someone may already have or that comes out, it's all good. That is the beauty of LEGO, with so many sets and themes available, there's something for everyone who collects and to pick and choose from.

author: TopperTwist
title: A Great Set, Worth My $45
review:
Introduction:

 This is a great set. I spent $45 on it, so question is, is it worth the money? Review in short: YES. With all the great features and playability, this set was fun for a TFOL like me, and would be great for younger and older fans alike.

Building the Set:

 This set was very easy to build, like many Lego City sets, too easy to build. I found no mistakes in the instructions, and the set came together very well. The only problem was of course color differentiation, and I don't remember the manuals showing us where to put a few of the stickers.

Features and "The Good"

The main feature of this set is the opening roof and doors of the trailer. There's also an unrealistic prison cell at the back, which adds to the playablility, but not the realism. The cab is nice enough, but with a gaping whole on the back of the cover for it. Anyways, good things about the set are the playability, doors, extra space, and the little red car of course!(not being much bigger than the Lego City Small Car set)

Minifigures and "The Bad"

The figures in this set were weak. Being only three, I expected a lot more from them. All we get is a decent detective, regular motorcop, and the same criminal we get in the Police Minifigure collection! On to the bad, of course the figures, the motorcycle being the same as every other one in Lego City, the empty room where it says 'police' on the door, and the lack of interior furniture.

Final Thoughts:

This set has many cons, however I really do think the pro's outweighed them for this set. With the great play value, nice look, and overall greatness, I think this set will look great in my Lego City, and yours too.

author: wollongong0
title: Mobile Police Unit
review:
Introduction


This set is called the Mobile Police Unit. It contains 408 pieces and it has 3 minifigures- 1 detective, 1 motorbike/ATV driver and a robber. Let's see the pros and cons.

Pros

  • Red Car
  • Prison at the back
  • Gold Bar
  • Storage Units
  • Roof opens up
  • Sides open
  • Tv
  • Computers
  • Tools- Flashlight, handcuffs and magnifying glass.
  • Coffee Machine
  • Satellite Dish
  • Lights
  • 33cm Truck
  • Police Motorbike

Cons

  • Too easy to build
  • Not enough minifigures
  • No little police station like the 7743 Police Command Centre
  • Wheels on the motorbike dont spin
  • While you are playing, the sides open up a lot
  • Expensive

Conclusion

This set is a great set. It has a red sports car and it has a jail at the back. This set is a very good set so buy this set. You will be glad you did.

By wollongong0
Remember to click on the helpful button!

author: rinaldo
title: A Mobile Police unit with prison moved by a beautiful truck
review:
The set 7288 Mobile Police unit is a classic such as LEGO City Police Station 7498 that can't miss in the AFOL or child LEGO collection. Every three/four years it is updated with a new release, and  in this case the set 7288 was introduced in 2010 and replaces the previous set Mobile Police Unit 7743 compared to what it seems to me that there has been a significant step forward in terms of appearance and content.


The set consists of:


  • Tractor of the Mobile Police Unit
  • Mobile Police Unit
  • Motorcycle Police
  • Red convertible car
  • Three minifigs: Policeman, Policeman in leather jacket (biker), Robber with striped white shirt 


The set is sold in a very large box-shaped rectangular, with four instruction manuals and three envelopes containing brick to build the bike respectively, the red car, the engine and the mobile units.

Following the scheme proposed by LEGO, it starts with the first instruction manual opening the envelope of brick number one and begin to assemble without difficulty the minifig motorcycle cop and robber, and then switching to build  the Police Mobile unit  (based on a skeleton: the 4530673 and a hull: 4579412, both specially made), then continue assembling the red car thief, also made without any problems.

At this point, you have to pass to the second instruction manual and the second envelope of bricks to build the tractor of the mobile unit. It should be noted the width of the truck driving equal to six stud, which gives a beautiful visual, the absence of doors for access to the cockpit, and the presence on both sides of the tractor vehicle of two compartments very well camouflaged.

Completed the truck driving is to achieve the Mobile Unit, so it jumps to the third instruction booklet and the last two bags of brick, and this, in my opinion, is the part of the set that requires more attention because it addresses the construction of three different parts (equipment storage, operating mobile unit and prison) different from each other and with elements rotating on hinges and coexist on the floor of the trailer (made with a baseplate borrowed from trains: 4594847).

I think this mobile unit is well done with the presence within the operational part of two completed computer stations, two big screens and a coffee machine; in particular I like the location of the prison, and I would have preferred the inclusion of some brick transparent inside the mobile unit, the ability to rotate the two yellow chairs and a retractable ladder to allow the police to come down from the unit. In addition, to be picky, the system used for the coupling of the tractor to the mobile unit is not the best and in the movement is not rare to see its release.

Completing the assembly of the whole set, one thing is clear: in the set the number of Minifig provided are few; in particular, I welcome the presence of two minifig policeman to be placed in the unity operation. In addition, it would be useful to provide other tools to create a checkpoint of the police to be placed in the front van.


After completing the assembly I believe are worth noting:


PRO


  • Opening system of the mobile unit
  • Prison on the back
  • Equipment storage
  • Cab of the tractor very nice
  • Motorcycle Police
  • Coffee machine


AGAINST


  • Few minifig!
  • Playing with the tractor, the two central doors tend to open
  • Absence of a system to rotate the chairs in the mobile unit
  • Absence of a scale to curb the minifigs from the mobile unit



Conclusions

As already said, I consider this a set that can not miss in the collection of a passionate (AFOL or small it is) for both beauty content, has lots of interesting game, and the improvement point can be easily provided with own collection.

However, I do not understand the choice of LEGO to do not provide the set a larger number of minifigs (at least other two will be nice to have).


Overall assessment

GOOD +


Here on my blog you can find the complete review with all the photos:

http://brickreview.blogspot.it/2012/10/lego-7288-unita-mobile-della-polizia.html

(it is available in Italian and English languages, moreover using the translate button
on the right side, is possible to translate the review using rh google translation in all the languages)

If you like this review, please leave me a comment here and/or on my blog
Thank you

author: Copycat
title: One of my favorite sets in my collection
review:
This is my favourite set that I own. I remember receiving this for my birthday when I was a kid. I spent all night building it and touched nothing else for the next 2 months. It is very nostalgic for me.

Building experience

The build was pretty easy for me but I'm not sure about it for a 5-year-old. However, it doesn't lose many points because it is still pretty easy.

Parts

This set isn't exactly great part central, but it has a motorcycle piece and computer screens, so it could be worse.

Playability

I remember after I got this set as a kid, It was the only toy I touched for two months (give or take) 

Value for money

I think this set was worth $45, and the price per part ratio isn't bad either.

author: BrickFactoryINC
title: Great Truck for a All time Great line
review: This semi Truck for the police was one of my all-time most played with set back when it came out.  Of course, being a part of one of the best Lego City Police lines of all time had great features and mini-figs to go along with it.  Off course, the mini-figs are never something to ride home about with 2 cops the police chief (exclusive), and a crook all the figs came together to make a valuable play experience.  Now there are some drawbacks it hasn't aged well and the roof of the trailer does have a tendency to fall apart.  Over all I would recommend it to anyone who loves lego city and remembers the old lego city short animations on Lego.com back in the day the Truck appears in several episodes.
